bill_title: appropriate money for repair, cleanup, and upgrades.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish the tobacco settlement fund and authorize certain expenditures from the fund. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is established within the state treasury the tobacco settlement fund. Any money received from the master settlement agreement signed on November 23, 1998, by attorneys general from the several states and various tobacco companies shall be deposited in the tobacco settlement fund. Expenditures from such fund shall be made only upon approval of the Legislature. The fund shall be declared a participating fund and all interest earned on the fund shall be credited to the tobacco settlement interest fund established in section 12 of this Act. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from the tobacco settlement fund the sum of four million dollars ($4,000,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Bureau of Information and Telecommunications for the purpose of statewide communication system upgrades. Section 3. There is hereby appropriated from the tobacco settlement fund the sum of one million five hundred thousand dollars ($1,500,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Human Services for the purchase of assistive devices for persons with neuromuscular diseases. Section 4. There is hereby appropriated from the tobacco settlement fund the sum of five million dollars ($5,000,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Board of Regents for the replacement of the roof on the Dakota Dome at the University of South Dakota in Vermillion. Section 5. There is hereby appropriated from the tobacco settlement fund the sum of eight million dollars ($8,000,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Environment and Natural Resources for the cleanup of environmental damage at the Brohm mine in Lawrence County. Section 6. There is hereby appropriated from the tobacco settlement fund the sum of three million dollars ($3,000,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Bureau of Information and Telecommunications for the upgrades and replacement of equipment necessary to comply with the Federal Communications Commission mandate to convert to digital television signals. Section 7. There is hereby appropriated from the tobacco settlement fund the sum of one million dollars ($1,000,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Human Services for tobacco use prevention purposes. Section 8. The secretaries of the Department of Human Services and the Department of Environment and Natural Resources, and the commissioner of the Bureau of Information and Telecommunications, and the executive director of the Board of Regents shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draws to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 9. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated shall revert to the tobacco settlement trust fund in accordance with § 4-8-21. Section 10. Any funds in the tobacco settlement fund not otherwise appropriated shall be placed in the tobacco settlement trust fund created by section 11 of this Act. Section 11. The tobacco settlement trust fund is established in the state treasury. The principal in the trust fund may not be expended. The fund shall be invested according to § § 4-5- 23 and 4-5-26. Interest earned on money in the fund shall be deposited annually in the tobacco settlement interest fund created in section 12 of this Act. Section 12. The tobacco settlement interest fund is established in the state treasury. The money in the tobacco settlement interest fund shall remain in the fund until appropriated by the Legislature. The fund shall be invested according to § § 4-5-23 and 4-5-26.
